intro: Zanthoxylum cyrtorbachium, commonly known as the Mexican prickly ash, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces red, fleshy berries that are an important food source for various wildlife species. Zanthoxylum cyrtorbachium is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its aromatic, thorny branches and medicinal properties have made it of interest in traditional herbal practices.
